subdisciplines.name: Abstract Expressionism
subdisciplines.description: A post-World War II art movement in American painting, developed in New York in the 1940s.

subdisciplines.name: Pop Art
subdisciplines.description: An art movement that emerged in the 1950s in Britain and the United States.

subdisciplines.name: Minimalism
subdisciplines.description: An art movement in the United States in the 1960s and 1970s, characterized by extreme simplicity of form.

subdisciplines.name: Conceptual Art
subdisciplines.description: An art movement that emerged in the 1960s and 1970s in which the idea or concept behind the work is more important than the finished art object.

subdisciplines.name: Postmodernism
subdisciplines.description: A movement that emerged in the 20th century as a reaction to modernism.
